meanings.definition: To form a close friendship or partnership with someone.
meanings.sent1: After meeting at the park, Sarah and Lily buddied up to play on the swings together.
meanings.sent2: In school, many students buddied with classmates to work on group projects.
meanings.sent3: The two kittens buddied together to chase a butterfly in the garden.
meanings.sent4: The colors of the sunset and the ocean buddied up to create a beautiful painting in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The warm sun and cool breeze buddied up to create the perfect weather for a picnic.

meanings.definition: A person's close friend or companion.
meanings.sent1: Tommy considered Jerry his best buddied at the playground.
meanings.sent2: During the camping trip, Sarah's buddied helped her set up the tent.
meanings.sent3: The teddy bear became the little girl's favorite buddied to cuddle with at night.
meanings.sent4: The old dog and the young puppy became fast buddied in the park.
meanings.sent5: The astronaut's spacesuit was his trusted buddied during the spacewalk.
